frame.name: Capital_stock
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns <fen>Stock</fen>, a purchasable and sellable asset representing a <fen>Shareholder</fen>'s share in a company (the <fen>Issuer</fen>). <fen>Stock</fen> entitles the <fen>Shareholder</fen> to profits of the <fen>Issuer</fen> company, as determined by the governing board of the <fen>Issuer</fen> company. LUs in this frame can denote the type of capital stock investment into a business (common or preferred) or the investment itself. Common stock is also known as ordinary stock or voting stock.
<ex><fex name="Shareholder">My</fex> <fex name="amt">ten</fex> <fex name="Type">preferred</fex> <fex name="Stock"><t>shares</t></fex> <fex name="Issuer">in Google</fex> are worth more than your ten common shares in Apple.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Stock
FE.definition: <def-root>The investment that a <fen>Shareholder</fen> makes into a business, differing from property and assets.</def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>The the kind of <fen>Stock</fen>, of which there are two: preferred or common. Holders of preferred stock are entitled to the first dividend that a company pays out, while holders of common stock are granted voting rights in corporate decisions.</def-root>

FE.name: Shareholder
FE.definition: <def-root>The creditor that has invested into a business by purchasing some <fen>Type</fen> of its <fen>Stock</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Issuer
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity that issues its <fen>Stock</fen> to the <fen>Shareholder</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Amount
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Amount</fen> is the number of shares, though any measure prase will suffice.
<ex>I have <fex name="Amount">ten</fex> <fex name="Stock">shares</fex> <fex name="Issuer">in Google</fex>.</ex> <ex>Berkshire Hathaway bought <fex name="Amount">majority</fex> <fex name="Stock">shares</fex> <fex name="Issuer">in IBM</fex> today.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: share.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: any of the equal parts into which a company's capital is divided.

lexUnit.name: common.a
lexUnit.definition:
COD: (of a share) entitling its holder to dividends which vary in amount depending on the forturnes of the company. Compare with PREFERRED.
FN: also entitles the stockholder to voting rights.

lexUnit.name: preferred.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a share) entitles the holder to a fixed dividend whose payment takes priority over that of ordinary share dividends.

lexUnit.name: stock.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the capital raised by a company through the issue and subscription of shares.

lexUnit.name: ordinary.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: Synonymous with "common" as in "common stock".

lexUnit.name: voting.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: Synonymous with "common" as in "common stock".
